title: The Milkmaid
text: Traditionally, Lucas's <I>The Milkmaid<I> was hailed as one of the first pure, genre subjects in northern European art. Superficially, the shepherd and milkmaid are performing the mundane chores of rural, daily life.However, in subsequent scholarship, erotic overtones have been suggested --specifically, an allegory of lust and free will. The basis of this thesis is the word <I>melkan<I> (to milk) in 16th century Dutch connoted <I>lokken<I> (to lure). Lustful intent has been perceived in the poses and costumes of the figures, landscape details, and prominently placed cattle.
